summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and attorney Teri Gibbs, coordinating interviews for two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein and discussing a hearing following Epstein's death. It reveals the logistical planning for victim interviews by the Southern District of New York prosecutors.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: A prosecutor with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, involved in coordinating victim interviews and communications regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney representing two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, communicating with prosecutors to schedule interviews and discuss logistics.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), whose indictment was to be dismissed following his death. The emails concern victim reports against him.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Epstein case who scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment and allowed victims to be heard.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: A New York attorney working with Teri Gibbs, mentioned as accompanying one of the victims to a meeting with prosecutors.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: An attorney cc'd on some of the email correspondence regarding the victim interviews.

connections.description: Attorney representing victims communicating and coordinating with the prosecuting Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding interview scheduling and logistics.
Teri Gibbs indicates Arick Fudali, a New York attorney, will accompany one of her clients to a meeting with prosecutors.
Lisa Bloom is cc'd on emails from Teri Gibbs regarding the victim reports, indicating a professional association.
Colleen Mullen is a prosecutor working on the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.
Teri Gibbs represents clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Hearing on Dismissal of Epstein Indictment
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a hearing regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. The order indicated victims could be heard.

events.title: Scheduled In-Person Victim Interview
events.description: Prosecutors scheduled an in-person interview with one alleged victim, referred to as 'Ms. [redacted]', at their office.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Victim Interview
events.description: Prosecutors scheduled a video conference interview (via Skype) with another alleged victim, referred to as 'Ms. [redacted]'.

events.title: Initial Discussion with Victim's Firm
events.description: Teri Gibbs's firm spoke with prosecutors regarding their clients who believe they were assaulted by Epstein around June 2004.

keyFacts: The emails coordinate interviews for two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein scheduled for late August 2019, one in-person and one via video conference.
A hearing was scheduled for August 27, 2019, before Judge Berman to address the dismissal of the indictment against Epstein following his death, with provisions for victims to be heard.
The prosecutors offered victim services, including counseling and travel assistance for victims who wished to attend the court hearing.
The victims' attorney, Teri Gibbs, provided photographs of the clients from 2004 and asked prosecutors to check if they appeared in photos seized from Epstein's home.
The correspondence reveals the ongoing investigative and procedural steps taken by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York after Epstein's death.
